subject: Mental Health
title: What Is PTSD?
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is PTSD?.

hook.text: PTSD is what happens when the brain gets stuck reliving a danger that's already over.

buildup.text: Flashbacks, nightmares, and severe anxiety persist long after the traumatic event.

discovery.text: About 6 percent of the population will develop PTSD at some point in their lives.

twist.text: Not everyone exposed to trauma gets PTSD â€” resilience factors play a major role.

climax.text: Without treatment, PTSD can last for decades and worsen over time.

punchline.text: The danger is gone. The brain doesn't know that yet.

quiz.question: What percentage of people will develop PTSD in their lifetime?
